member.name: T:AddinExpress.WD.ADXRegionBorderStyle
member.summary: Specifies the border style for a region.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.WD.ADXRegionState
member.summary: The default states of the region to which the forms created by the current collection item will be embedded.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.WD.ADXOutlookVersion
member.summary: Outlook versions.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.WD.EmbeddedFormStates
member.summary: The state of an ADXWordTaskPane.
member.remarks: An instance of the ADXWordTaskPane can be in one of three states determined by the Active and Visible properties of the instance. When on top of the set of ADXWordTaskPane instances in a given layout, the Active property of the instance is True. This state is called Active. When not on top of the set of ADXWordTaskPane instances in the layout, the Active property of the instance is False. This state is called Visible. When not in any layout, the Visible property is False.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.WD.EmbeddedFormStates.Visible
member.summary: The ADXWordTaskPane is not on top of the set of instances in a layout.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.WD.EmbeddedFormStates.Active
member.summary: The ADXWordTaskPane is on top of the set of instances in a layout.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.WD.ADXOlExplorerLayout.FolderView
member.summary: The form will be shown below the Reading Pane's content. This will also show a header allowing the end-user to switch between the form and the Reading Pane's content.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.WD.ADXOlSplitterBehavior
member.summary: Splitter behavior.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.WD.ADXOlSplitterBehavior.None
member.summary: The user is unable to resize the form. The developer is able to resize the form programmatically.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.WD.ADXOlSplitterBehavior.Standard
member.summary: The user is able to resize, show, or hide the form. The developer is unable to resize the form programmatically.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.WD.ADXOlInspectorLayout
member.summary: Regions available for embedding an ADXOlForm into inspector windows.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.WD.ADXOlInspectorLayout.Unknown
member.summary: The form will not be shown.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.WD.ADXOlInspectorLayout.TopSubpane
member.summary: At the top of the body of the message, task, etc

member.name: F:AddinExpress.WD.ADXOlInspectorLayout.BottomSubpane
member.summary: At the bottom of the body of the message, task, etc

member.name: F:AddinExpress.WD.ADXOlInspectorLayout.RightSubpane
member.summary: In the right part of the body of the message, task, etc

member.name: F:AddinExpress.WD.ADXOlInspectorLayout.LeftSubpane
member.summary: In the left part of the body of the message, task, etc

member.name: F:AddinExpress.WD.ADXOlInspectorLayout.InspectorRegion
member.summary: Underneath the body of the message, task, etc. This will also show a header allowing the end-user to switch between the form and the message itself.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.WD.ADXOlCachingStrategy
member.summary: Caching strategies when an ADXOlFom is embedded into an explorer window.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.WD.ADXOlCachingStrategy.None
member.summary: A new instance of the ADXOlForm will be created whenever the user switches between folders.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.WD.ADXOlCachingStrategy.NewInstanceForEachFolder
member.summary: While in the same explorer window, the same instance of the ADXOlForm will be shown whenever the user navigates to the same folder.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.WD.ADXOlCachingStrategy.OneInstanceForAllFolders
member.summary: While in the same explorer window, the same instance of the ADXOlForm will be shown for every folder from the folder set that the FolderName(s), ExplorerMessgageClass(es), and ExplorerItemTypes properties constitute.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPaneInstancesCollection
member.summary:
Represents a collection of ADXWordTaskPane instances created by a ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem (see also Remarks).
If the Show Windows in Taskbar flag is cleared in Word 2002, 2003, 2007, the collection contains exactly one instance.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPaneInstancesCollection.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Returns an object that implements the System.Collections.IEnumerator interface and that can iterate through the ADXWordTaskPane objects within the ADXWordTaskPaneInstancesCollection collection.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPaneInstancesCollection.CopyTo(System.Array,System.Int32)
member.summary: Copies all of the elements of the current ADXWordTaskPaneInstancesCollection collection to the specified one-dimensional array, starting at the specified destination array index.
member.param: The one-dimensional Array that is the destination of the elements copied from ICollection. The System.Array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which copying begins.

member.summary: Gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPane
member.summary: A highly specific version of the System.Windows.Forms.Form class designed for being embedded into Word windows.
member.remarks:
This class and its base class (AddinExpress.Extensions.ADXForm) override a number of properties, methods and events of the System.Windows.Forms.Form class.
In addition, this class provides a number of members that relate to the architecture of Add-in Express Extensions for Word. For instance, you can access AddinModule, FormsManager, and Item properties.
An ADXWordTaskPane can be in one of three states determined by the Active and Visible properties of the instance. When on top of the set of ADExcelTaskPane instances in a given layout, the Active property of the instance is True. This state is called Active. When not on top of the set of ADExcelTaskPane instances in the layout, the Active property of the instance is False. This state is called Visible. When not in any layout, the Visible property is False.
When you need to show a form in a usual way, say as a dialog window, use the System.Windows.Forms.Form class.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPane.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPane.Show
member.summary: Embeds the ADXWordTaskPane into the layout specified by the ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem (see the Item property).
member.remarks: When the ADXWordTaskPane is embedded, its Visible property is True. To move the form on top of the set of ADXWordTaskPane instances in the layout, use the Activate method.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPane.Hide
member.summary: Hides the ADXWordTaskPane.
member.remarks: The Visible property of the ADXWordTaskPane becomes False.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPane.ADXPostMessage(System.IntPtr,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Sends a custom message to the internal window of the add-in. When the message is received, the ADXWordTaskPane raises the ADXPostMessageReceived event.
member.param: A value that will be available in the ADXPostMessageReceived event.
A value that will be available in the ADXPostMessageReceived event.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPane.components
member.summary: Required designer variable.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPane.CurrentWordWindowHandle

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXCloseButtonClickEventArgs.DisableItem

member.name: T:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollection
member.summary: A collection of items that manage task pane embedding. Every item (of the ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem type) specifies the form (of the ADXWordTaskPane type) to be embedded as well as position and other aspects of form embedding.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollection.Copy
member.summary: Creates a new ADXWordTaskPanesCollection object and copies all collection items to this object.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollection.Clear
member.summary: Removes all items from the collection.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollection.Add(AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem)
member.summary: Adds an ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem to the end of the ADXOlFormsCollection.
member.param: The ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem to be added to the end of the ADXWordTaskPanesCollection.
member.returns: Either the ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem (existing or just added) or null (Nothing in VB.NET).

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollection.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem at the specified index of the ADXWordTaskPanesCollection.
member.param: The zero-based index of the ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem to remove.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollection.IndexOf(AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem)
member.summary: Searches for the specified ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem and returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence within the entire ADXWordTaskPanesCollection.
member.param: The ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem to locate in the collection.
member.returns: The zero-based index of the first occurrence of value within the entire ADXWordTaskPanesCollection, if found; otherwise, -1.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollection.Contains(AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem)
member.summary: Determines whether an element is in the ADXOlFormsCollection.
member.param: The Object to locate in the ADXWordTaskPanesCollection. The value can be a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
member.returns: true if formsItem is found in the ADXWordTaskPanesCollection; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Removes the item from the ADXWordTaskPanesCollection,
member.param: The ADXWordTaskPanesCollection to remove from the ADXWordTaskPanesCollection.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollection.Owner
member.summary: Returns the ADXWordTaskPanesManager which is the owner of the collection.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollection.Item(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem at the specified index.
member.param: The zero-based index of the ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem to get.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem
member.summary: Represents an item in an ADXWordTaskPanesCollection.
member.remarks:
First off, you specify an ADXWordTaskPane in the FormClassName property and set the Enabled property to True.
To show instances of the ADXWordTaskPane in Word, specify an appropriate layout in the Position property.
To be able to resize the ADXWordTaskPane programmatically, you set the Splitter property to None.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.IContainer)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An IContainer that represents the container for the component.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.ShowTaskPane
member.summary: Creates an instance of the ADXWordTaskPane for current document. If the instance exists, fires an exception.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.GetCurrentTaskPaneInstance(AddinExpress.WD.EmbeddedFormStates)
member.summary: Returns an instance of the ADXWordTaskPane (specified in the TaskPaneClassName property) in the specified state.
member.remarks: An instance of the ADXWordTaskPane can be in one of three states determined by the Active and Visible properties of the instance. When on top of the set of ADXWordTaskPane instances in a given layout, the Active property of the instance is True. This state is called Active. When not on top of the set of ADXWordTaskPane instances in the layout, the Active property of the instance is False. This state is called Visible. When not in any layout, the Visible property is False.
member.param: The state of the instance of the ADXWordTaskPane.
member.returns: The instance of the ADXWordTaskPane or null (Nothing in VB.NET).

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.Collection
member.summary: Returns the ADXWordTaskPanesCollection which is the parent of the ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.TaskPaneInstances
member.summary: Returns the collection of created TaskPane instances.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.CurrentTaskPaneInstance
member.summary: Returns the current ADXWordTaskPane instance which is currently shown (or hidden).

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.Position
member.summary: Specifies the position the instance of the ADXWordTaskPane specified in the TaskPaneClassName property will be embedded into.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.AlwaysShowHeader
member.summary: If False and an only instance of an ADXWordTaskPane is shown in Position, the header isn't shown.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.CloseButton
member.summary: If true, the close button will be displayed for every instance of ADXWordTaskPane which class name is specified in the TaskPaneClassName property. When the user clicks the button, the corresponding ADXWordTaskPane fires the ADXCloseButtonClick event.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.IsHiddenStateAllowed
member.summary: If false, the hidden state will be unavailable through the user interface for the region showing an instance of ADXWordTaskPane whose class name is specified in the TaskPaneClassName property.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.TaskPaneClassName
member.summary: Returns or sets the class name of an ADXWordTaskPane instances of which will be created and shown by the ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.Enabled
member.summary: If false, no ADXWordTaskPane instances will be created and shown.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.Splitter
member.summary: Specifies the splitter. If this property is set to None, the corresponding ADXWordTaskPane can be resized programmatically.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.DefaultRegionState
member.summary: Returns or sets a value of the ADXRegionState type that specify the default state of the region to which the taskpanes created by the current ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem will be embedded. The value specified by this property is applied only once - if no Add-in Express taskpanes were ever embedded in the regions specified by the current ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem when your add-in is run on a given PC for the very first time. In all other circumstances, the state of the region is controlled by the user.
member.remarks: A region can be in the following states: normal, hidden (collapsed to a 5px wide strip), minimized (reduced to the size of the form caption).

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.Tag
member.summary: Returns or sets a string value that can be used to store data associated with the ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.RestoreFromMinimizedState
member.summary: Returns or sets a Boolean value specifying the display of the pane created by the current ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem when the region is reduced to the size of the form caption (i.e. when it is in the minimized state) and the user clicks on the form caption. If the value is true, the region will be restored to the normal state. If the value is false, the form will pop-up overlaying the adjoining part of the Word window, in which the form is embedded.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.UseOfficeThemeForBackground
member.summary: If set to true, the color of the current Office theme is used to paint the background of ADXWordTaskPane. Otherwise, the color set at design-time is used.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.RegionBorder
member.summary: Determines whether to show a frame arround the region or not to show.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.AllowedDropPositions
member.summary: Returns or sets a value (or a combination of values) of the ADXWordAllowedDropPositions type, specifying the regions to which and from which the user can drag-and-drop the forms created by the current ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem.

member.name: T:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesManager
member.summary: Word Forms Manager. The main class of the Add-in Express Extensions for Word.
member.remarks:
The folowing classes constitute the architecture of the Add-in Express Extensions for Word:
ADXWordTaskPanesManager
ADXWordTaskPanesCollection
ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem
ADXWordTaskPane
You start with adding an item to the Items collection and binding it to an ADXWordTaskPane which is the base class for every form embeddable into Word windows. Then you process events provided in ADXWordTaskPanesManager and ADXWordTaskPane.
The most notable event in this class is ADXBeforeTaskPaneInstanceCreate.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesManager.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesManager.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.IContainer)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An IContainer that represents the container for the component.

member.name: M:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesManager.SetOwner(System.Object)
member.summary: This member supports the Add-in Express infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
member.param: An instance of the Add-in Express AddinModule class.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesManager.AddinModule
member.summary: Returns the add-in module the component is located on.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesManager.WordAppObj
member.summary: Returns a reference to Word.Application (a COM object).
member.remarks:
The COM objects provided in this member are essential for Add-in Express Extensions functioning. That's why you must never release them. On the contrary, you must release every COM object obtained from them.
To release a COM object, you use the ReleaseComObject method of the Marshal class located in the System.Runtime.InteropServices namespace.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesManager.Items
member.summary: A collection of items that manage form embedding. Every item (of the ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem type) specifies the form to be embedded as well as the position and other aspects of form embedding.

member.summary: Occurs before the Word Forms Manager is initialized.

member.name: E:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordTaskPanesManager.ADXBeforeTaskPaneInstanceCreate

member.summary: Returns the exception that is the cause of the event.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXErrorEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: Returns or sets a boolean value that specifies if the OnError event is handled by the developer. If it is false (default), the Extensions shows an error dialog.

member.summary: Provides data for the ADXBeforeTaskPaneInstanceCreate event of ADXWordTaskPanesManager.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXBeforeTaskPaneInstanceCreateEventArgs.Cancel
member.summary: If true, prevents creating an instance of the ADXWordTaskPane defined in the TaskPaneClassName property of the ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem which is specified in the Item member of this class.

member.name: P:AddinExpress.WD.ADXBeforeTaskPaneInstanceCreateEventArgs.Item
member.summary: Returns the ADXWordTaskPanesCollectionItem that is about to create an ADXWordTaskPane instance.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordSplitter.None
member.summary: The user is unable to resize the form. The developer is able to resize the form programmatically.

member.name: F:AddinExpress.WD.ADXWordSplitter.Standard
member.summary: The user is able to resize, show, or hide the form. The developer is unable to resize the form programmatically.
